newsitem.title: USA: ACCESS energy prices fall after API reports builds.
newsitem.headline: ACCESS energy prices fall after API reports builds.

text.p: U.S. energy futures prices eased Tuesday during overnight ACCESS trade, pushed lower by a report that showed rising stocks in crude and gasoline nationwide, traders said.
U.S. crude oil stocks rose 6.94 million barrels last week to 322.63 million barrels, while gasoline on hand at U.S. refiners grew by 6.5 million barrels, to 197.06 million.
NYMEX crude oil for June delivery traded at $21.07 at 1819 EDT/0119, down 30 cents a barrel from the daytime close.
After-hours, 1,360 crude oil lots changed hands for June, with total volumes at 2,800 lots.
NYMEX June heating oil fell 0.53 cents a gallon to 55.95 cents as 144 lots traded for June, and 255 for all months.
NYMEX June unleaded gasoline futures prices fell 0.16 cents a gallon to 63.60 cents a gallon, with 417 lots changing hands in June and 470 traded in all months.
